cover.alt: Diabetik is right at home on both iPhone and iPad.

embed__versionios6.alt: The original iOS 6 version of Diabetik.
embed__versionios6.figcaption: The original iOS 6 version of Diabetik.

embed__beforeafter.alt: The iOS 6 version of Diabetik on the left, and the iOS 7 version on the right.
embed__beforeafter.figcaption: iOS 7 was a drastic departure for Diabetik in terms of visual identity. By using colorful icons and subtle typography, we countered the stark white look.

collage.alt: Diabetik's Journal view is designed to make digesting large amounts of data pleasant.
collage.figcaption: Diabetik's Journal view is designed to make digesting large amounts of data pleasant.

collage.alt: Laying out the month cards on a grid allows the user to monitor their progress.
collage.figcaption: Laying out the month cards on a grid allows the user to monitor their progress.

cover.alt: Helpper's iOS app fits right in with their existing style guide and marketing direction.

collage.alt: On first launch, the user is welcomed with clear steps on how to use the app without making the user feel dumb.
collage.figcaption: On first launch, the user is welcomed with clear steps on how to use the app without making the user feel dumb.

collage.alt: Editing your profile on the go is as easy as tapping the edit button.
collage.figcaption: Editing your profile on the go is as easy as tapping the edit button.

collage.alt: It was quite a challenge to build a screen this packed with information and UI elements.

collage.alt: Error messages are styled accordingly and provide clear instructions to the user.
collage.figcaption: Error messages are styled accordingly and provide clear instructions to the user.

cover.alt: I designed an elegent website for Immo Brown.

collage.alt: The website was designed with a mobile-first approach to make the design feel right at home on smaller displays.
collage.figcaption: The website was designed with a mobile-first approach to make the design feel right at home on smaller displays.

collage.alt: With some smart but tiny adustments to the code, the design really pops on larger displays.
collage.figcaption: With some smart but tiny adustments to the code, the design really pops on larger displays.

cover.alt: Scorecard allows people to keep score while playing board games with friends & family.

embed__patternlibrary.alt: A small snippet of the pattern library.
embed__patternlibrary.figcaption: A small snippet of the pattern library I created for Scorecard.

embed__iphonetoipad.alt: The iPad version is not simply a blown-up iPhone app.
embed__iphonetoipad.figcaption: The iPad version is not simply a blown-up iPhone app.

embed__playerdetails.alt: The 'Player Details' flow was kept within reach.
embed__playerdetails.figcaption: By keeping the player details within reach, the UI is more comfortable to use.

collage.alt: Going with two columns on iPad makes the UI more functional.
collage.figcaption: Going with two columns on iPad makes the UI more functional.

collage.alt: Scorecard - Add a Game
A dark version of the app was also designed.
collage.figcaption: A dark version of the app was also designed.

collage.alt: The gameplay screen tints its background and various UI elements based on the game color.
collage.figcaption: The gameplay screen tints its background and various UI elements based on the game color.

collage.alt: Teams are defined as a grouped cell.
collage.figcaption: Teams are defined as a grouped cell.

collage.alt: Most of Scorecard's UI is based around tinting UI elements with the game color, giving the app a more personal look and feel.
